title: Augusta County: John Scott to George Whipple, April 22, 1866
summary: Concerned about the future well being of the schools in Staunton, John Scott writes to Secretary George Whipple arguing that AMA teacher C. E. Dewey's imminent departure from Staunton would lead to a teacher shortage in the area. He inquires if employing one of his top "scholars" as a teacher would be a viable solution to the problem.
keywords: African Americans, Education, Race Relations, Women, American Civil War
